definitions.definition: used to express the cost or amount of something for each person, number used, distance travelled, etc.

examples.text: Rooms cost £50 per person, per night.
France consumes around 200 000 tonnes of cocoa **per year**.
This country has a higher crime rate per 100 000 of the population than most other European countries.

definitions.definition: following something that has been decided

examples.text: The work was carried out as per instructions.

definitions.definition: in the way that is normal or usual; as often happens

examples.text: Everyone blamed me as per usual.

wordOrigin: Latin, ‘through, by means of’; partly via Old French.
